runs.comm: well, it's not Groundhog Day - yesterday he started with three dots. Great start for Gayle, though, a lovely, well-timed extra-cover drive from a regulation half-volley
another brilliant cover drive from Gayle, merely leaning into that and Broad chases down inside the boundary
across the righthander, shape in the air, hits a good length and holds its straight line through to Prior
a pair of dots now, as Sidebottom bowls slightly wider across him, and he leaves the ball alone
shot for none by Simmonds that, early on to the front foot and pushing into the covers
driven on the up to cover, where it's picked up easily
left alone outside off; a tidy start for Anderson
on leg, tucked off the hips to square for a quick single
backs away and tries to lash a cut off the back foot - the ball sailed right over middle stick and he was well outside the line down leg
backs away again and tries to hit the cover off it - lashes only air, though, and the ball slides into his leg, way outside leg once more
comes down the track this time, and once more misses out - the aggression isn't working
flash outside the off stump, Simmonds misses out once more and walks down the pitch to have a word with his captain, shaking his head
down leg and chased round
driven to midwicket
slower ball, picked, and that was nearly the first six of the day over midwicket. Instead it's a one-bounce four
in the air and goes over cover with a huge thick edge; chased down by Collingwood and also Pietersen, who wins the race
width outside off and smashed with a delicious cover drive that runs all the way
outside off, turned just in front of square
outside off, another well-smote shot, this one a forceful cut off the back foot, with plenty of wristing
flicked off the hips, leg up a la Lara, to bring up another boundary in two balls
outside off, driven straight through mid-off, beating Mascarenhas
good change of pace
wide, down leg, greeted by boos from the crowd
rushed into the pads on leg, Gayle too early with the shot
yorker, dug out to mid-on to steal the strike - that will please Sidebottom I don't think... or in fact Stuart Broad.
on leg, wristed down to Mascarenhas at short fine leg who tidies up sharply
attempts a wristy flick through mid-off, gets an inside edge... and a single
slower ball, on off, Gayle doesn't get hold of it... but it still races away through midwicket
moves back to give himself room - exposes the stumps, but gets something on it
driven straight to mid-on
disgustingly good from Simmons - flicking a hook through fine leg. Nice
quick single from a push
half-volley smashed on the up over cover
backed away, trying to repeat the aerial stuff, but he picks out the fielder over at third man where Broad takes a good catch
doesn't time that one, driving to mid-on
short, straight bouncer, well swayed and well pouched by Prior
slower ball, better thinking, Richards pulling up on the shot, defended forward
full delivery ends a decent over, and it's defended down
ooh, slunk through but just missed the leg stump - Gayle backing well away to try to launch through wide mid-on
rushed at that one outside off
fuller, eased to Pietersen at backward point
good bowling, Richards not able to get that away
straight delivery, nipping up sharpish, Richards pouncing to defend the ball down off the back foot
driven to long-off for an easy single
starts with a wide, shooting that way across the lefthander
on leg, tucked off the hips to square
slower ball, clever, Gayle waits and dabs down to gully
up and over, a huge outside edge falls way short of Sidebottom at third man
left alone outside off
slower ball, worked to leg and it's Prior's first "Get-on-that" of the day
slower delivery, driven into the covers
hopeful shout for lbw, as that pitches on (possibly outside) leg, and wouldn't have hit leg, anyway
straight, on a good length, defended into the covers
slapped down the ground over long-on
big shot, strong through midwicket
full and straight and that's a much better appeal... on line at least. Sounded like an inside edge
backs away, tries to flat-bat cut straight, on the back foot, to mid-on
width, and cut away
worked into short midwicket
wide, outside off, and dabbed well off the back foot through point for a comfortable two
on leg, waits, looks to work round and in the end leaves it too late to connect properly
slower ball, but Gayle doesn't miss out - thwacking a fat six over midwicket to bring up his 50 from 28 deliveries
on a good length, wide outside off, waits and cuts over the ball
a huge straight six off the bottom of the bat, a full-length delivery, just smashed
outside off, wide
wide outside off again
played almost on the run, driving on the up to mid-off for a quick'n
late crouching cut, which we liked, great commitment from Anderson, saving a boundary, which we also liked
bunched off the hips behind square
What a catch! Ah, not a catch. Clean, diving forward effort from Pietersen at long-on... but it just bounced in front of him
had to adjust to the flight, the ball coming into him tighter than expected, and he squeezes out to mid-on
over the wicket, pushed to midwicket, and it's "Get on that" time from Prior
Broad sprawls to his left to get on that
on off, driven on the up, safely, towards Anderson who nearly bowls the ball back in
ah yes, down the ground, huge straight six over the sightscreen and nearly into the media box
goes up and over extra cover
slower delivery, worked into the on-side
quick single this time to rotate the strike
slower delivery
a top-edge up in the air to short fine leg where Broad clings on with palms upwards, Aussie-style
outside off, chopped through third man. He's really got his eye in... again
driven to mid-off to pinch the strike
tries to launch down the ground and squirts the ball square
pushed up there, poked back out
pushed up there, tries to pull through midwicket, ends up sending it straight to long-on
in the air - and the spectators become fielders; the fielders spectators. That was big, right off the back foot over long-off
good reply from Mascarenhas, shuffling a slower ball outside off, worked down to gully
slower ball, again, out of the back of the hand, ended up being a long hop, but it was cut off inside the rope
a touch of wobble away, but that's well climbed into with a late cut swiped well away

slower ball, more swing in the air, and that's a huge swept pull right up to Mascarenhas at wide long-on. Great catch by Mascarenhas, running in, but running back out to take the ball with fingers pointing up
hoicked over to the extra cover boundary where Pietersen does his best to make a hash of things, but still keeps the ball inside the rope... somehow
attempted offcutter, great improvisation, on his knees and flicking it round through fine leg, just eluding Anderson
worked square, more good fielding from Anderson, making up for yesterday
slower ball, driven to mid-off.
good flight, quick single... and had to be with Prior underarming to the non-striker's end
worked out to long-on where Sidebottom, like a curly-haired gazelle, gallops over to do the fielding honours
on one knee, waits... and defends
shimmies down, to meet the ball and drive to mid-off
straight drive to long-off, well driven
on leg, on one knee, tries to swish to fine leg... completely misses and the ball clatters into his body
outside off, a huge heave, connects only with air
outside off, misses again
slower delivery, down leg, chipped away for an easy single
soft dismissal, flicked up to mid-off for a fairly simple catch over his shoulder
yorker outside leg, nutmegs him, Prior tidies up
driven to mid-off
pushed up there, intelligent, defended
another yorker, dug out again
leg-side full toss... you can guess - a huge six over midwicket
flatter delivery, but another full toss, this one on off, swatted straight towards mid-off
tucked off the toes to midwicket for a quick single
right up there, driven on the back foot to long-off, where a Pietersen misfield allows the two
outside off, drilled off the back foot to Pietersen who makes no mistake at long-off
outside leg, slower ball, clever and Sidebottom smiles as he takes the ball over his shoulder. Morton was completely deceived there
worked into midwicket this time
yorker, swatted out to long-off - a good shot but Pietersen did really well at long-off, picking up the ball, steadying himself, and swishing in to Prior who does the rest
slower ball, waited, jabbed down... Sidebottom cannons into Bravo there and falls over... smiles, and pretends to have done his hamstring.
pushed up there, defended
good ball, on a decent length, cut over on the back foot
outside off, driven off the back foot through cover where Trott does some good fielding on the boundary
outside off, cut on the back foot through cover and there was a mix-up as Trott returns from deep cover, but it's well picked up
on the money, driven out and there's another tight one - Ian Gould asking for the replay this time
great reply, bouncer and Sammy is all over the place, laughing as he manages to get his bat back into the crease
another run out chance... but into his crease well
